sections.name: Tristian (Level 1)
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Good
traits.text: Good effects often manipulate energy from good-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to evil divine servants or divine servants of evil deities. A creature with this trait is good in alignment.

traits.name: Aasimar
traits.text: A creature with this trait has the aasimar versatile heritage. Aasimars are planar scions descended from celestial beings. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by aasimars.

traits.name: Human
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the human ancestry. Humans are a diverse array of people known for their adaptability. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by humans.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

traits.name: Forceful
traits.text: This weapon becomes more dangerous as you build momentum. When you attack with it more than once on your turn, the second attack gains a circumstance bonus to damage equal to the number of weapon damage dice, and each subsequent attack gains a circumstance bonus to damage equal to double the number of weapon damage dice.

traits.name: Sweep
traits.text: This weapon makes wide sweeping or spinning attacks, making it easier to attack multiple enemies. When you attack with this weapon, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your attack roll if you already attempted to attack a different target this turn using this weapon.

traits.name: Range
traits.text: These attacks will either list a finite range or a range increment, which follows the normal rules for range increments.
